intro: Randia racemosa, commonly known as the clustered randia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in racemes, hence its common name. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Randia racemosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
